history.content:
I know that the department is currently looking for instructors for 70, but in order to be offered, they need to find at least one grad student who is willing to co-instruct--and that's generally harder than finding undergraduates.  (Due to this uncertainty, I don't think anyone knows when we'll know for sure if it will be offered or not.)  I'd say it's reasonably likely that they'll find someone and be able to offer the course, but I would still recommend having a backup plan.

As for deadlines, this page says the deadline to enroll is June 28th, so you should have plenty of time to plan things out.  (In the past there hasn't been much of an issue with people in 70 not being able to get off the waitlist, though it's probably still a good idea to not play with fate by leaving enrollment to the last minute.)

children.subject: By when will we know for sure?

history.content:
If it will be by when would be known by? I'm just trying to formulate my summer plans.

Additionally by when do we have to enroll in summer classes?

Thank you!
history.subject: Will CS70 be offered in the summer? It is no listed on classes.berkeley.edu
